comments:
I200403260010

Entering a wrong password to access my SSH2 private keyring results in a stack
trace in .log. I would either expect
- nothing in .log
- an entry that a wrong password was entered (and for what) without stack dump
- some message next time I log-in: n invalid passord attempts

I agree that we could do better with the current CVS password prompt. I can't 
dupe the bad password with SSH2 enabled, but got the following with extssh. We 
are going to work on polishing SSH/SSH2 connections methods with respect to 
cancellation/prompting for M9.

I like the idea of showing <number> of login attemps. It's important to know 
when to cancel before you are locked out of an account :)

Verified that a log message is no longer generated. When an incorrect password
is entered the next prompt simply says to enter the password, and doesn't say
why the authentication failed.

That will have to be done post 3.0
This exception is occuring in the old SSH1 plugin which is no longer used.

traces.message: Authentication error: Invalid username, password, host or repository
